alert.note: Alert for Chelan; Douglas (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 11 at 2:31PM PST until January 11 at 3:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: The National Weather Service in Spokane has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... West central Douglas County in north central Washington... South central Chelan County in north central Washington... * Until 300 PM PST. * At 230 PM PST, a dangerous snow squall was located from Cashmere into the Wenatchee area. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. This includes U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 111 and 135. Locations impacted include... Wenatchee, East Wenatchee, Cashmere, Rock Island, Sunnyslope, East Wenatchee Bench, South Wenatchee, West Wenatchee, Monitor, and Malaga. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED SNOW SQUALL IMPACT...SIGNIFICANT
